column4: i am trying to make a usb start disk. using the option in system>administration>create a usb start disk
it seems to build it ok
but cannot boot to it.
have verified that bios is set correctly
even tried marking it bootable with fdisk
could anyone point me in the direction to get this working?
have you tried plugging the stick into different USB ports ?
if your bios is set correctly and the USB Boot Stick was created correctly then it should be working
I will try that.
sometimes the ports on the backside of the system are on different  ..... circuts than the font USB Ports (sry cant think of a different word other than circuts atm)
i only have 2 on the side of my laptop.
oh i didnt realize you were using a laptop, i was invisioning a desktop
so do you think that would still be the issue?
no, but when you set up your bios did you make USB the 1st on the boot list ?
yes... I have also tried an option to boot to a temporary device and pointed it to my usb drive, which it lists by name "sandisk cruizer 2.0 gb"
or something close to that
how did you make the boot stick ? by the guide on the web site ?
just used the tool in the menu
brb
what guide on what website btw?
hang on a sec, theres a  guide on the web site, i'll try to find it for you.
check this page out : https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromUSBStick
